alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 12:20PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeast Windsor County through 100 PM EDT... At 1219 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saxtons River, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Springfield, Weathersfield, North Chester, West Springfield, and Weathersfield Bow. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
